qas.question: When was the final defeat of the Ptolemaic Kingdom?
When did the capital of the Roman Empire move to Constantinople?
What term defines the influence of Greek culture?
Where did the Roman Empire move to in 330 AD?

context: Scholars and historians are divided as to what event signals the end of the Hellenistic era. The Hellenistic period may be seen to end either with the final conquest of the Greek heartlands by Rome in 146 BC following the Achean War, with the final defeat of the Ptolemaic Kingdom at the Battle of Actium in <a0_0>31 BC<a0_0/>, or even the move by Roman emperor <a1_0>Constantine the Great<a1_0/> of the capital of the Roman Empire to <a4_0>Constantinople<a4_0/> in <a2_0>330 AD<a2_0/>. "<a3_0>Hellenistic<a3_0/>" is distinguished from "Hellenic" in that the first encompasses the entire sphere of direct ancient Greek influence, while the latter refers to Greece itself.
